data.scheme_name: Karnataka Tourism Policy 2020-26 - Interest Subsidy - New
data.benefits: Interest subsidy shall be provided at 5% per annum on the term loan taken, subject to a maximum of Rs 25 Lakh.
data.eligibility:
Following Tourism Projects are eligible for Interest Subsidy –
1. Agri Tourism Project
2. Cultural Tourism Project
i. Cultural Village
ii. Museum & Gallery
3. Heritage Tourism Project
i. Heritage Hotel
ii. Sound & Light Show
4. Safety and Hygiene Tourism Project
i. Mobile Toilet Van Project
data.conditions: Tourism Project must be undertaken on land owned by the Applicant to be eligible for Interest Subsidy.

data.prerequisites:
The Tourism Project must commence operation as per the following timelines – If the Eligible Project Cost is upto INR 5 Crore then in 2 years If the Eligible Project Cost is more than INR 5 Crore then in 3 years A Tourism Project availing Interest Subsidy shall not be entitled to claim Capital Investment Subsidy and vice-versa.

 Tourism Project must be undertaken on land owned by the Applicant to be eligible for Interest Subsidy. Components considered under Eligible Project Cost for the respective Tourism Project shall only be considered for the interest subsidy.
data.nodal_agency: Department of Tourism, Government of Karnataka
data.context: To provide a framework for Karnataka’s tourism industry to overcome ongoing difficulties, adapt to new norms, and remain competitive in the global tourism landscape.
data.objective: Karnataka aims to boost tourism for economic growth and employment, ensure visitor safety and comfort, promote globally, enhance infrastructure, attract private investments, and pursue sustainable development aligned with UN goals.
data.description: New Tourism Projects shall be eligible to get interest subsidy at 5% per annum on the term loan taken on the fixed capital investment for the Tourism Project, subject to a maximum of Rs 25 Lakhs for a period of five years. The interest subsidy shall not exceed Rs 7.5 Lakhs per annum for the Tourism Project and shall be provided only for timely repayment of loan instalment along with interest.
data.how_to_apply:
The applicant can apply through the below link:
https://tourismpolicy.karnataka.gov.in/
data.funding_mechanism: Interest Subsidy shall be reimbursed only after timely payment of loan instalment along with interest.
data.additional_info:
Fixed capital investment shall mean the investment in fixed assets for the purposes of developing Tourism Projects defined under Karnataka Tourism Policy 2020-26. The assessment of fixed capital investment shall be as per the guidance for assessment of Eligible Project Cost. The Interest Subsidy shall be reimbursed to the Tourism Project who pays regular loan instalments and interest thereof. 

If the Applicant / Tourism Project defaults for any period, it will not be eligible for reimbursement of interest subsidy for that default period. The default period will be deducted from the eligible period of 5 years. 

Expansion Tourism Project shall mean an Existing Tourism Project that is taking up an expansion of more than 50% of its existing capacity in terms of built-up area and/or EPC for the Project

. Only one expansion project of an Existing Tourism Project will be eligible for incentives, subsidies and concessions during the operative period of Karnataka Tourism Policy 2020-26.

 New Tourism Projects and Expansion Tourism Projects for only the following Eligible Tourism Projects shall be eligible for availing Interest Subsidy under the Policy – 

1. Agri Tourism Project

 2. Cultural Tourism Project i. Cultural Village ii. Museum & Gallery

 3. Heritage Tourism Project i. Heritage Hotel ii. Sound & Light Show

 4. Safety and Hygiene Tourism Project i. Mobile Toilet Van Project
